inn1.comm: length, pitch a yard wide of off stump and swinging away, steps out and leaves
touch shorter and again curving away from the right-hander, who thinks about playing and is beaten past his outside edge
fuller, trying to draw Simmons forward outside off, he leaves again
tantalising stuff from Jimmy, pulling Simmons across and squaring him up to beat the edge of the bat
touch short of a length, prodded into the off side and they quickly abandon any hopes of a run
good length and shaping away, genuine leave from Simmons
pitched up outside off, gets forward and dabs a single towards mid-on
back of a length and angling in towards the batsman, Simmons gets back and defends
pitched up outside off and Simmons steps forward to ping a stonking cover drive through the infield and away for four - shot!
pulls his length back and the batsman gets in a bit of a tangle trying to work to leg
back of a length outside off, goes back and steers a single down to third man
good length, on middle and leg and darting across, Gayle gets solidly behind it
length ball, on off and shaping away, solid forward defensive
wide of the stumps and no movement this time, Simmons lets it through
length delivery, pitching in line with off and straightening, jabbed into the off side
beaten again, pushing at the ball as it leaves him - terrific stuff from Anderson so far
straighter line and seaming back this time, Simmons is hit on the thigh pad trying to flick to leg
pitched up outside off and swinging away, big step forward and leaves
length ball on the legs and chopped square, straight to a fielder
pitched up outside off and Gayle drives firmly at this one, his first shot in anger - only for Ravi Bopara's diving stop at cover to prevent any return
short and wide from Finn, Gayle's eyes light up like a fruit machine that's about to pay out ... but his cut shot is miscued and loops to point on the bounce
tighter line from Finn and this time it's defended watchfully into the off side
excellent delivery, on off and drifting away as Gayle pushes at it a little uncertainly, the ball flying through to Kieswetter
another teaser, darting past the outside edge as Gayle withdraws his bat
length ball on off stump ... and Simmons dabs it behind point for a run
what a leave! Gayle is grinning after letting one go through that came back around off and missed the stumps by a matter of inches
length ball and angling across, Gayle goes for the big 'un over cow corner and gets an inside edge to long leg
good length on off, pushed back down the track
straighter, drifting on to the pads and worked towards midwicket
back of a length, Simmons gets across and defends in to the ground outside off
back of a length and climbing past the batsman as Gayle drops his bat out of the way
slides on to the pads and this time Gayle connects, showing his power with a chunky glance in front of square leg
four more! Though this wasn't an authentic stroke, the ball slicing high off the toe of the bat and over third slip as the ball left Gayle off a good length
more punishment for Finn, picking up a straight, length ball and belabouring it back down the ground for a boundary at long-on
full and wide of off, Gayle skips out and crunches a drive straight at the mid-off fielder
good comeback from the bowler, pushing one through and beating the batsman outside off
length ball outside off and Simmons has a big ole yahoo, completely missing the ball
pushed short on the off side, no run
good length ball in the corridor, tries to drive and ends up squirting the ball into the leg side
back of a length, on leg stump and rising at the body, defended back on to the track
length ball, on the stumps and blocked
strays down leg and flicked behind square for one
short of a length, leg-stump line and Gayle doesn't connect with an attempted glance
precise line and length from Finn, the ball bouncing and leaving Gayle, who purses his lips as is fizzes past
length, on the stumps, Gayle opens those broad shoulders again but this time the hack skews into the leg side for one
pitched on a good length in the corridor, Simmons gets forward and has a thrash but connects with the bottom of the bat, Finn fielding in his follow-through
back of a length and dabbed short on the leg side
pace and bounce off a good length, angling down leg and hitting Simmons on the thigh pad as he swipes at the ball
length ball, speared across and pushed towards cover-point
leg-stump line, Gayle stays still in the crease and knocks short on the on side
and Boom goes the dynamite! Anderson dropped short and Gayle smashes a pull shot deep into the stand over the midwicket boundary. That had both wings and a jet pack
fuller and on the stumps, worked off the pads
short of a length and tickled into the off side
forward defensive on off stump
on the stumps and prodded back down the pitch
overpitched on the stumps and this one is dispatched back down the ground for another Dorothy, Gayle so still at the crease as he watches it sail away
there he goes again, stepping out to flat-bat another brutal hit straight back over Bresnan's head!
line and length, plays this one more watchfully
Gayle has taken a liking to Bresnan's pace (or lack thereof), it seems, attacking him again but slapping his drive to a fielder

monstrous, monstrous hitting from Christopher Henry Gayle! Bresnan was a touch short and Gayle stepped away and mullered him on to the roof of the stand above the players' dressing rooms - tidal wave, tsunami, here it comes!
length ball outside off and glided behind point for a single
length ball, straight and no movement, blocked respectfully back to the bowler
length ball, angling across and pushed into the off side
slightly full from Anderson and Gayle languidly deposits the ball straight back down the ground for his fifth six! That brings up the Windies fifty - and Gayle has 47 of them
back of a length and on the legs, flicked square for a single
Simmons gets across and defends - he doesn't need to worry, with Gayle carrying the heavy load at the other end
touch short and played circumspectly back towards mid-off
fuller length, Bresnan rolls his fingers over it and Gayle steers it behind point for a single
short ball, shovelled round the corner for one
full and on the stumps, Gayle dabs this one into the off side
tight line again and tapped into the off side - the Kraken appears to have drifted back into the deep for now
length ball and nudged short of midwicket, the big man lumbers into gear and takes one to bring up a half-century that has been horrifying for England and utterly compelling for everyone else
round the wicket to Gayle, tossed up on the stumps, tickled into the leg side
length outside off, defended towards cover
flighted on off stump, driven for one
gives it some air, on the stumps and Gayle steps out to nudge to the on side
flatter, pushed through on off and blocked back to the bowler
full and flighted, Gayle seizes on it, doesn't properly connect with his thump down the ground but it takes a good stop at long-on to prevent four
good length on the stumps, pushed back down the track
touch short of a length, Gayle's instincts kick in again but his pull over mid-on isn't quite out of the middle and it drops short of the man on the rope
length ball outside off, gets behind it in defence
this one nips back a bit and hits Simmons on the thigh pad
pushed through in the corridor, left alone this time
length ball and Simmons gets a leading edge that drops just short of Bresnan as he throws himself forward
tossed up outside off and played back
flighted and blocked back to Swann
flatter ball on off and defended on the front foot

flat delivery, not much turn and there's a big lbw appeal ... it's given but Gayle immediately reviews it. Swann was pleading, imploring for that decision and Tony Hill gave it after an age. There's definitely bat involved but was it pad first? There's no doubt the ball was going on to hit. It's practically impossible to tell if the ball squeezed on to the pad via the bat or the other way around. Perversely, the crowd probably don't want him to go ... but he has to, as the decision is upheld!
tossed up outside off and defended on the back foot
flighted on the stumps and again blocked watchfully
length ball blocked back down the track
outside the line of off and pushed to cover
touch short and Simmons launches the ball into the outer stratosphere for a huge six gets behind it in defence
drifting down the leg side, the batsman misses with a flick and Kieswetter collects
back of a length and jabbed away towards point
good length ball outside off and pushed on the front foot to cover
touch short and blocked outside the line of off

wide-ish and Smith nicks off! The ball might have left him a touch and he went for a full-blooded mow, only to thin one through to the keeper. Bit of a gimme wicket, that, and England's decision to bowl first is looking less like the madness it seemed 10 minutes ago
back of a length and shaping away, pushed into the off side
pitched up and Samuels is down on one knee to hammer a drive straight at the cover fielder
length ball, doesn't get up as Samuels tries to cut off the back foot but he gets a couple via a bottom edge to fine leg
wide of the stumps and punched lazily square for an exquisitely timed boundary through point - hold the pose Marlon
pitched up and nurdled round the corner to long leg
defended into the leg side from a good length ball on off stump
wide of the wicket, stays back and steers the ball away with soft hands, fielded in the gully
bumper, tight line and Samuels hops back and across to defend
good length delivery, patted behind square on the off side
length, angling in and with the pace taken off, Samuels shuffles across and can't get the ball away
touch short and Simmons swings his arms at this one, but the cut bounces down into the ground and is fielded at point
pitched up outside off, defended solidly back down the track
full and straight and on-driven for one back past the bowler
terrific ball from Broad, angling in and then holding its line and Samuels groped at it
full and driven to mid-off
tries the bouncer and Samuels is a little late on it, top-edging a hook into a gap in front of deep square leg
good length and a bit of bounce for the bowler, the ball jarring into the top of the bat
full length and Samuels seizes on it, timing an effortless drive wide of mid-off - he's almost level with Lendl already
drags his length back a touch and defended
on the stumps, pushed back past the bowler for a single
slides his line too far across to leg and Simmons has no chance of hitting that, though he tries gamely

down leg again and Kieswetter takes a superb catch, leaping to his left ... it looked like Simmons had been strangled (not before time, some Windies watchers might say) but the ball actually came off the thigh pad
short and angling back in again and dabbed to leg
pitched up and nudge to mid-off, they take a sharp single

Simmons tries the same thing and Cook, who had come in a yard or two, runs him out with a direct hit from mid-off! Good piece of work from the captain, leaving the batsman half a yard short. Simmons has to go and he trudges off at about the same pace with which he scored his 12 runs
good length and blocked solidly
tight line on the stumps, Samuels guides this to gully
bumper, at the man, who leans out of the way

Samuels - who I was about to say looked in good nick - top-edges a brisk bouncer straight to deep midwicket! He got in a tangle against a short ball a couple of overs back but it lobbed short ... this time the miscue sailed high and not-so-handsome to the fielder on the rope
gets back and across to a short ball on the stumps
slightly fuller length, pushed on the front foot to cover
pushed through in the corridor outside off, left alone
good line and length from Finn, another leave from Polly
another watchful leave to a length ball shaping away
angled in towards the top of off stump and squeezed into the leg side for one to get Pollard up and (literally) running
slightly back of a length, angling towards leg stump and again dropped short of midwicket for a quick single
pitched in the corridor, touch short and Bravo gets across to show it the full face of the bat
good length, outside off and pushed into the covers coming forward
tight line on off, Bravo gets across and covers up his stumps
back of a length and this one rises fiercely, the batsman does well to keep it down
fuller length in the channel outside off, no stroke
pacy bumper from Finn and Pollard, who's a big fella, folds himself in half to avoid it
short of a good length and dropped short on the off side, Pollard wants one but Bravo sends him scampering back as the fielder swoops in from point
short again and defended into the off side on the back foot
length ball on the stumps, blocked back to the bowler
good length outside off, tempting Pollard forward, who pushes firmly to cover
sliced off a thick edge for a single down to third man
back of a length and Pollard rides it to steer the ball to third man
on the stumps and blocked towards mid-on
length ball in the corridor, no shot from Bravo, who's content to play himself in
tight line on off, short of a good length, pushed towards mid-off on the back foot
steered wide of cover from a length ball outside off, they hustle through for one
back of a length, good line from Broad and Pollard drops his hands out of the way
full and flicked down to long leg where there's a good sliding save
forward to block a length ball just outside off, the lofted drive is practised afterwards
pressed forward just outside off and blocked to point
full, nipping back, a large cry for lbw, not out, must have hit it and indeed there is an inside edge, this is definitely bat first
shorter in length, a flashing cut stroke misses outside off
forward just outside off and blocked back up the wicket
full and flicked down to long off
just outside off and a bit of an edge into the off side
forward to block in a similar region
punched down the ground
stood back and punched into the on-side, a fine save at midwicket
more flight and tucked to the same fielder
full just outside off and blocked
fine shot, punched out through the covers, only to the sweeper though
couple of steps down and heaved off an inside edge over midwicket and this races away for four, fortune favours the brave
ran back to the bowler with a forward press
bumper and ducked, he had taken another step down there
worked out behind square on the leg side, the scramble a second
forward and blocked around off stump
more flight, he got a light outside the line of the ball and ran it back to the bowler
floated up and blocked with an angled bat outside off
taken from outside off and chipped over midwicket and it races down for four, a lovely little shot, placed to perfection between long on and deep midwicket
blocked back to the bowler again
step back and cut out to deep cover
full just outside off and lashed over wide long off, excellent strike into the stands
Bresnan drops his length back and defends into the off side
full just outside off, pushed into the covers
wide of off stump and called as such, harsh for me I thought that was inside the guidelines
short and turned to long leg, Bell in quickly to field
turned to long leg again
length and punched to mid on, but they'll get a stupidly unnecessary overthrow, the return to the keeper landed on leg stump, was there really any idea
chipped in the air down the ground of a leading air and oohh! Morgan racing in can't quite hold on after the dive forward, that would have been special, just dropped it on landing, great effort
back to defend around off stump
step back to cut and missed
taken off the stumps in front of square leg, good scramble from square leg to field
down the wicket and blocked with bat and pad together
step back and cut down to long off
length, dropped into the covers, they take a quick single
length, played forward and pushed to midwicket
push to mid on from a length
back of a length and dropped down to long leg
dropped in short and hooked, not in control and it lands short of the men in the deeo
pushed down the wicket and they take another run
ourside off and an inside edge to square leg
down to paddle sweep and gets it very fine for four, good stroke
slapped down the ground but only for one to long on
off stump line, dropped into midwicket
from wider on the crease, fired in and hurried rushed to midwicket
flicked into the deep on the on side
front-foot drive of a thick outside edge to third man
bit of a hack down to long on from outside off stump, might have been looking to line up Bopara there
full length, tailed in a bit, driven to the cover sweeper
angled into the pads, deflection to long leg
length outside off, went for the late cut and missed
excellent yorker and well dug out
length and pushed to midwicket
misread the length and ended up back and squirting it out to square leg
misread the length again but raw power gets a big six over cow corner, huge inside edge that flew into the crowd
pushed back to the bowler, well saved
blocked coming forward
missed stumping, Swann fires one under the bat of Pollard but Kieswetter has spilt it behind the stumps. That is a sitter really and an awful miss that could prove costly
way down leg
full ball and flicked out to deep midwicket
leg side and flicked to fine leg for four, poor ball
another leg side wide, poor over this
blocked back up past the bowler
drive off a length to extra cover who's on the edge of the cricle
great shot, a big extra cover drive that finds the gap, powered away
turned behind square on the leg side from back of a length
length just outside off, pushed to point
waited for and driven to point, a shy at the stumps - with the batsman so comfortably home - produces a ricochet and an overthrow
fine stroke, using the pace of the ball to run it to third man for four from short of a length
short and better-directed, an awkward hook to 45
played back up the wicket from outside off
fine stroke, powerfully pulled away, picked up the slower ball and hammered to the sqaure boundary
angled in, comes off the pad and runs towards third man, Kieswetter intervenes
wide and lashed to third man where no-one is home, poor ball, nicely placed
better, straighter and pushed down the ground for one
step across the stumps and flicked to square leg, they scramble through for the run
angled in to middle and leg, pushed to midwicket
slower ball bouncer, missed as Bravo tries to turn it around the corner
step to leg, a big heave, an outside edge whirls down wide of third man, who is able to come round and field
powerfully pulled to deep midwicket, straight to the man
waist-high full toss, slipped out and called no-ball, certainly surprised Bravo who dropped the bat
this time length and angled to point
angled to point again
short, went for the pull from outside off stump, missed it
back of a length, dropped into cover and they take a sharp single
leg stump and ran into midwicket for just a single, England would take five more
step to leg, Bresnan followed him and fired it in full, clipped out to deep midwicket in the end
slower ball and short, Bravo gets it past the 45
full, tailing in, pushed down to long off

got him! Heaved into the deep but it went more up then long and it's easily taken by Anderson, in fact not that much in the deep, he came in off the rope because it was that much of a miscue. The bouncer eventually works against Pollard and that's a vital strike for England at an important time
defended to point for an easy single
pushed out through cover, there's now a sweeper back
forward on off stump to block
more flight offered, forward to block again on off stump
tucked to midwicket
touch short and stepped back to pull out to deep midwicket
flatter and blocked back to the bowler
middle and leg stump pushed to midwicket, the slide can't prevent a run
pushed to midwicket again
short ball, pulled fine, just helped down to fine leg, it's almost a mis-hit but it works
back of a length, slightly slower, dropped into the covers
taken from middle and off, played to long leg, fumble by the substitute Bairstow allows them a comfortable single
awkwardly fended off a shorter ball behind square leg
pushed between long leg and deep midwicket from a full length
stepped back and cut through the covers
punched back to the bowler
step back and heaved over long on, I didn't think he'd caught this well enough to start with but enough bat to get it into the crowd
full and pushed out to deep midwicket
lashed away through the covers for a single
length ball and ran back up the wicket
slower ball, comes off the thigh pad and a diving stop from a Kieswetter
length and punched to mid off who's on the edge of the circle
fine ball beats the outside edge from back of a length
bumper, hooked at and missed, Bravo was a few days late on that
full and chipped wide of long on for four, picked up deliciously
fired in and tucked to midwicket
strong shot past short midwicket and such it beats long on for four, well played
full and outside off, flicked at and missed
full again and ran into the covers
waited for and moved through the on side, Finn scrambles and puts them off the second
full toss on leg stump, it comes off a bit of a top edge and flies over long leg for six. I was thinking out to start with that is a handy maximum
heading down leg, comes off the body to the keeper
punched into the covers with no timing, just one wide of extra cover
pulled to midwicket on the bounce, they turn down the run that was probably available

cracked straight to point and England strike at a good time. It was short and wide really but Sammy couldn't have picked out the fielder better, he's upset and rightly so, given it away when he was moving along well
back of a length just outside off, Ramdin fiddles at it and misses, slip a possibility here?
similar delivery, this time chopped down to third man
angled into the off side, Ramdin gets himself off strike as he has to do now
excellent yorker, dug out to point
edged and gone Ramdin, for some reason, steps away to try and a swing a length ball through the off side and nicks off. Poor decision really, just run the singles and let Bravo do the hitting
perhaps a slip eh? This goes right where first slip would have been off a genuine outside edge for four to third man
driven to extra cover, firmly
chopped down behind point
short and this is horrendous, a step down, the away, then swings himself to Richmond with a mighty woosh
down the track and another big yeeehaa, this time clubbed to long off
heaved up and towards cow corner, lucky to get away with this, it went miles up and landed between midwicket going back and deep midwicket coming round
full ball missed outside off, another mighty swing
length, turned to midwicket for one
another huge swipe, comes off an inside edge via the pad and ends up going nowhere

swung straight up in the air, this is coming down with snow on it and well taken by Bopara at extra cover. It hung up in the air for an age but Bopara steadied himself well and clung on going slightly behind himself, a jolly good grab and Bravo's fine knock is over
calmly left outside off stump! A rarity with a handful of balls to comes
another edge through the slip cordon, still no-one at home, at least third man can come round to cut this off
another almighty swing from the hip, blasted down to long on
full on leg stump, silly appeal for lbw, the scramble a leg bye, they're actually referring this but surely it pitched outside leg stump, and indeed it did, not out
and now this is a wide outside off
made up for it though with a good yorker just outside off stump
full toss punched to mid off
slower ball, well disguised, Best swings and misses
fired in as Best moves to leg, off the pads to the keeper

followed him and beaten again in between the pads and the stumps, they try to take a bye to the keeper but Kiestwetter finds the stump with the underarm and Narine is easily run out. Excellent work after the diving roll.
full toss and punched down to long on
and he swings and misses at a slower ball again

inn2.comm: on the legs and nibbled through square to get Cook off the mark first ball
length ball, seaming back in from outside off, chopped square on the off side
full and straight, Bell steps forward and punches to mid-on
drifts down the leg side and the ball flicks off Bell's pad and dribbles away for a couple
length ball in the corridor, Bell goes back and across and dabs to point
tight line on the stumps, the batsman gets solidly behind the ball in defence
and he's quick and on line straight away, Cook blocking in the front foot into the on side
full and wide of the stumps, Cook leans out and uses the pace on the ball to glide a square drive for four
length ball, quick stuff from Tino but Cook stays back and deflects the ball to third man
bumper from Best but it doesn't live up to the bowler's name, Bell up on his toes and whipping his wrists through a pull shot that sails over square leg and away for another boundary
pitched up outside off and pushed into the covers
dropped to mid-on and they call for a tight one, picking up overthrows when the shy at the non-striker's end misses
back of a length on the stumps and dropped to midwicket
length ball outside off and left alone
line and length and this time Bell gets across in defence
touch short and wide, Bell guides a sweetly timed drive off the back foot between point and cover, an elegant, eye-catching shot
back of a length and chopped towards point playing back
good length and angling in towards the stumps, pushed towards mid-on
fired well across the stumps - looked like a wide but not called
speared wide of the stumps again and Cook leaves
on the pads and worked through midwicket, good stop prevents a run
short and too much width, Cook swings from the hips in the wild West style, pistoling a cut through point
angled across on a better line, left alone this time
good pace and carry for Best, again up around 90mph, Cook steps out and leaves
teasing line and length from Rampaul, elicits a play-and-a-miss from Bell outside off
length delivery, slightly wider and this time Bell leaves
fuller, too wide this time, Bell has to reach for it and steers to third man for one
length delivery, pushed square on the off side
Cook shuffles across and is falling over slightly as a length ball straightens on leg and thunks into the knee roll - probably pitched just outside the line
flicks this one off the pads behind square
drifts on to the pads and tickled to midwicket
angled across and pushed towards cover from around off stump
length ball, stays a bit low and Cook somewhat awkwardly chops it through cover
effort ball from Best, which angles in on off and gets up, Bell rides it and dabs short of point for a quick single, much to Best's frustration
good length ball, on the stumps, tapped to the man at cover
on the pads and Cook leans out and dabs short of mid-on
pitched up on the stumps, blocked to leg
length ball, sliding across and steered to the man at point
back of a length and room for Cook to swing his arms, chopping the ball through the gully region
pitched up and driven back towards the bowler, half-fielded but they take a comfortable one
full and straight, Cook brings his bat down at an angle and gets a leading edge along the ground wide of mid-off
pitched up outside the line of off, steered down towards third man
full and down the leg side ... wide
shorter and again veering down the leg side, it swings once past the batsman and Ramdin can only deflect it to long leg via the tips of his gloves
better line, around off and ducking back in, defended
length ball pushed into the off side
back of a length outside off, Bell hops back and clatters a cut shot through the infield to the square boundary
straighter, rolling his fingers over the ball and flicked off the legs through square for a couple
full and straight, ducking in towards off, Bell drives and the bat turns in his hand, the ball screwing away behind square on the leg side for another boundary
pitched up on the stumps and punched to mid-on - good over for England, frustration beginning to get the better of Tino
full and leaving Cook, who steps out and spanks a cover drive away for another crisp four
on the stumps and dabbed to mid-on
another classical shot in the 'v' from Cook, punching straight down the ground past the despairing dive of mid-off - that brings up the fifty, at a quicker lick than the Gayle-powered Windies
tighter to the stumps and squirted down to third man
decent line and length from Rampaul, who's been the tighter of the two bowlers, and Bell leaves
full-ish and on the stumps, punched to the man at mid-off
round the wicket, good line, slightly wide and defended on the front foot
width again and this time Cook tucks the ball away square on the off side
wicket to wicket, tickled off the pads square on the leg side
full and straight, Bell punches a drive to mid-on
pitched up on the stumps again, clipped past midwicket for a couple
slightly full, slightly to leg-stump in line and Bell fillets a dreamy four through midwicket, looked like a mere flick of the wrists but the ball races away
on the stumps and worked through square leg
tossed up and defended in front of off
tossed up and dabbed round the corner to fine leg
flighted around off, pushed into the covers for one
defended in front of the stumps
on the pads, slight spin, clipped through square on the leg side
length ball, tight line on the stumps, pushed back down the ground for one
round the wicket, pitched up around off, pushed into the covers coming forward
well wide of the stumps, Cook throws the bat at it and thick-edges through gully for a single to third man
length ball, angling down the leg side, glanced square
good length, outside off and holding its line, pushed through cover off the back foot
length ball, tight line on off, chopped to short third man who cuts off a run
floated up around leg, not much turn, defended on the front foot
flighted, down the leg side, tries to sweep but the ball comes off the pads
blocked in front of the stumps
tossed up around off, worked into the leg side
full length, played back to the bowler
flighted on off, spinning in and tucked down the ground to long-on
on the stumps, forward defensive
wide and a touch short, Bell slaps a cut shot straight at the fielder
fuller length, rolled out of the hand and the batsman mistimes a drive to mid-off
sliding across, bit of width, Cook blaps a cut shot low to backward point
length ball, angling in towards the stumps from round the wicket, pushed wide of mid-on
full and straight, Bell casually taps a drive to long-on to rotate the strike again
length ball, wide of the stumps, persuaded gently through the covers to the sweeper
flighted, on the stumps, dabbed to mid-off
touch shorter and swept from in front of the pads
tossed up outside off and Bell reaches out to slide a paddle-sweep fine on the leg side
drops a little bit short, spinning across and Cook chops enthusiastically behind point for four
round the wicket now, flighted around the line of off, Cook goes down on one knee and bunts this one over midwicket for another authoritative boundary
short and well wide, Cook just manages to get the toe of the bat on it
cracked through the covers, great work by the sweeper, saving with a tumble to his left
wide outside off
brilliant. Angled in and punched back past mid on for four, that is awesome
tucked down to long leg
worked down the ground on the front foot
firm punch to extra cover
forward to push back to the bowler
length and tucked to mid on
pressed to short midwicket on the front foot
step back and tucked through point
cut away out to deep cover
punched down to long on
cut out to point again
whoops, short and hammered out to the midwicket fence, loosener dispatched
played forward, an edge to square leg
stepped back and cut to the right of the cover sweeper so they can take two
this time cut with more power in front of the sweep and this is four, well timed
back and just blocking this time
clipped back to the bowler
worked wide of midwicket and they scramble very well back for the second, excellent running
worked squarer so straight to the midwicket sweeper
stood back and punched down to long on
dropped to midwicket for another run
quicker, left outside off
floated up and clipped to short midwicket
miscued on the pull, lands short of deep midwicket
back of a length with the keeper up the stumps, punched back to the bowler
wide of off stump, cut stroke misses, Bell is disappointed
too straight and whipped out behind square on the leg side for four, very well timed
wide of midwicket this time on the front foot and they take two
nice looking drive but only to mid off
blocked coming forward onto off stump
blocked forward again
back this time and tucked just wide of midwicket but not past mid on
pushed to midwicket
fired in quicker and punched to mid on, on the back foot
blocked to cover, a maiden, need a few more of them
outside off and driven to extra cover
caught at cover and West Indies do at least get something. Bell went on the drive on chipped an offcutter straight to Chris Gayle at cover. Useful bit of bowling that and a lifeline for the tourists
pushed out very easily to deep cover, poor ball to the new man for me
pulled in control down to deep square leg
dropped into the leg side on the back foot
front foot nudge into the off side
full and pushed back to the bowler
cut to point, probably a little too full to cut
pushed to midwicket
outside leg, swept and missed
too short, pulled away for four but it wasn't too far away from short midwicket's hands, the dive wasn't enough to get up to take it, powerfully struck too
easy push down the ground to long off
moved around the corner to long leg on the front foot
guided down to long leg
tucked in front of extra cover for a quick single
tucked towards deep cover
another cutter grips and takes the outside edge towards cover, short of the fieldsman though
pushed into the on side from the crease
full around off stump and blocked back to the bowler
back of a length and pulled out to deep square leg, easily dealt with
left outside off stump
very full, going for the yorker, drifting down and Trott squirts it in between deep square leg and long leg
similar full ball, tucked to midwicket
too leg sumpish and tucked out to deep square leg
full outside off and edged to backward point
cut towards that same fielder but just short of him
slower and fuller, punched down to long on
back foot and tucked to midwicket
full ball just outside off, punched to cover
forward and driven to short midwicket
slower ball around middle and off, punched to mid off
angled across the left-hander, pushed at and missed by Cook
punched to extra cover on the front foot
length ball driven to extra cover
full and wide by only driven to point, Cook missing out and just getting a little stuck at the moment not getting off strike as easily
finds the fielder again with a drive, another maiden
defended around middle and off back to the bowler
there's a release, too short and pulled for four
delicately guided to third man
driven firmly to mid off
nailed it again to the fielder!
bumper, the slowest I've ever seen, but somehow gets up enough for Cook to miss it
leg side wide
tucked across the stumps slightly but down to long leg
short and pulled and Cook find the fielder again! But this time it's ok because he's one the long leg rope
driven cross the covers to the sweeper
slower ball on leg stump, pushed out to deep square leg
step across the stumps and a clip out to deep midwicket. Casual
blocked back towards the bowler on the stumps
Front foot push out to deep point
very full and missed outside off stump
finally beats the off side in-field and takes one out to deep point
forward to block around off stump
blocked around off stump coming forward
length outside off and tucked to extra cover
forward on off stump and blocked towards extra cover
there we go, a little bit of intent from Cook, a step down and push to mid on for a scrambled single
pushed to midwicket on the back foot
slapped down the ground with a sort of straight pull, a diving save from mid on
length ball lifted up and over straight midwicket for four, fine strike, giving this medium-pace bowling some treatment
now worked to mid on for another run
make that 15, short and wide, goes to uppercut and gets a top edge very fine for four well away from any fielders, he was trying to go up but perhaps not that fine
slower ball on leg stump, ran to deep midwicket for a single
back foot push to mid on
length just outside off, forward to block
forward again blocking is Trott
a little step to leg to open up the off side, slapped between extra cover and mid off for four, lovely strike
cut in front of deep cover, they return for two on a misfield
short and pulled to the other sweeper
tucked out to the leg side sweeper on the front foot from a length ball around middle and off
length on off stump, pushed to midwicket
finds midwicket again, this time with a front foot stroke
shorter and pulled to the sweeper
length and pushed down to mid on
flicked off the legs through square leg into the deep
pushed into midwicket on the crease
front foot ran to cover
back foot push to midwicket
slightly short, inside edge back to the bowler as Trott tried to pull
very full and clipped through midwicket, a fine piece of fielder keeps them to one
flicked wide of midwicket for a single to long on
you can't drop short at this pace, hammered to cow corner lifting it up and over midwicket
full and ran back to the bowler
firm drive doesn't beat mid off, well it sort of does in the end with a misfield, they take two because of it
well wide and called so
cut...and...no saved at point, it was a firm stroke but just the single
round the wicket, steered to short third man
short and wide and slapped dismissively behind point for a single that takes Cook to his fifth ODI ton - and third in six matches
on the stumps and pushed to mid-on
angled in towards the stumps, nudged into the leg side
full and straight, Cook chips over midwicket for one to the sweeper on the rope
length ball, wide of the stumps, cut away for another single
length ball outside off, solid defensive
short and whipped away through midwicket to the man in the deep
back of a length, on off stump, punched on the back foot to mid-off
outside off, pushed towards point
short ball, Trott tries to swing it through the leg side and edges it on to his pad, the ball dropping short and they take one - though, much to Trott's chagrin, it's credited as a leg bye
little bit of width, a fraction short and Cook smacks this one with relish through cover-point, looked like it came off the toe but the ball fair raced away
on a length outside off, pushed to cover
drifts to leg and Trott flicks through square for a couple
line and length outside off, nudged through the covers
Sammy drops short and Cook absolutely Gayles it over wide long-on. It didn't go quite as far as a CHG special, actually, but that was right out of the screws all the same

tries to heave another one out of the ground but this time a top edge flies straight up in the air and mid-off comes across to make the catch a few yards behind the stumps. More ruthless efficiency from England's ODI captain, who has earned the plaudits again (even if he's not the dasher some wish he were)
floated up and punched through the covers
short ball and Trott ducks underneath it
back of a length again and this time pulled through midwicket
length ball, sliding down the leg side, glanced for a single
defended in front of the stumps
length ball outside off, Trott leans out and deflects to point
full and tailing down the leg side, clipped firmly through square for one
pushed through outside off and punched through the covers
flighted, bit of spin back into R-Bop, who defends back on to the wicket
little bit short and Bopara cuts back to cut, comes off a thick edge but stays low and beats slip before running for four
tossed up and screwed through the infield square on the off side
flighted outside off, cut to the man at point
full and in the corridor, Bopara gets out to smother the ball in defence
now he lets go, and Trott gets forward in defence outside off
back of a length and the ball loops slowly through as Trott attempts to paddle the ball round the corner
floated up towards the blockhole, clipped through the leg side
full and outside off, pushed into the covers
pushed towards point off a length
dobbled through on off, pushed short of cover for one
full and chipped down the ground for one
tossed up outside off, spinning in, defended on the back foot
played back to the bowler coming forward
drifting across towards leg, glanced square
flighted, drifting in towards middle stump, stays back and defends
decent length but Bopara goes deep in his crease to effectively make it a short delivery and lasers a cut behind point
length ball and pushed through the covers
slow bouncer, Bopara picks it and swivels to pat the ball square on the leg side
deflected to point off a length ball
pushed through the covers to the sweeper
overpitched and cover-driven for one
short of a length again, Trott miscues a pull shot into the ground
tossed up outside off, nudged into the leg side
full and ticked down the ground for one
cuts at one that is a bit close, it slices off the edge but drops sharply and Gayle, at slip, falls over backwards as the ball skids by at ankle height
clipped off the pads - and Narine had overstepped
no, though he does try, skipping down and under-edging an attempted hoick into the leg side
flighted and Trott covers his stumps
length ball, spinning across from outside off, flicked behind square on the leg side
Pollard delivers it from a few yards behind the crease (but crucially in front of the umpire) and Trott pushes it to cover
length ball ... Trott lets it through
length ball, Trott gets a leading edge into the off side
nudged off the pads to midwicket - this one might still go the distance you know
here we go, Trott nudging short of mid-on and (at last) they scamper one
and Bopara doesn't muck around, dabbing another quick single to mid-on - that's it, England have won by eight wickets and seal the three-match series
